w:r.w:t: Collected daily from selected local farms.
Delivered fresh every morning in glass bottles.
No dilution. No preservatives. No mass processing.

because real quality cannot be rushed, diluted, or industrialized.

but because we refuse to lower standards.

The MAP Standard defines how milk and food products are handled at Madugai.
It is an internal operating discipline â€” not a marketing claim.
Every decision, from sourcing to delivery, follows this standard without exception.
Milk quality is not determined at the shelf.
It is determined by how strictly it is handled before it reaches the customer.
The MAP Standard exists to remove shortcuts, excess handling, and compromises that dilute integrity.
Milk is collected only from selected local farms that meet defined handling and hygiene expectations.
Volume is secondary. Consistency is mandatory.
Milk is collected and transported exclusively in
SS 304 food-grade stainless steel milk cans
This prevents contamination, avoids chemical interaction, and maintains hygiene during transit.
-grade containers are not permitted under the MAP Standard.
Milk is chilled immediately after collection.
There is no prolonged exposure, no waiting period, and no unnecessary movement.
This preserves freshness and natural quality.
Milk is not processed for extended shelf life or mass circulation.
The MAP Standard does not allow industrial shortcuts designed for convenience.
Milk is handled strictly for daily consumption.
Milk is delivered only in reusable glass bottles.
Plastic contact is avoided by design.
Glass preserves integrity and enables a controlled circulation system.
Customer onboarding stops when capacity is reached.
This ensures consistency, accountability, and quality control.
The MAP Standard is enforced daily.
Not selectively. Not seasonally. Not when convenient.
Madugai handles a small range of daily-consumption food products.
Each product follows the same discipline of sourcing, handling, and delivery defined by the MAP Standard.
Collected daily from selected local farms.
Chilled immediately and delivered fresh every morning in reusable glass bottles.
Prepared from carefully handled milk under controlled conditions.
No artificial additives. No enhancement. No shortcuts.
Prepared in small batches and handled under clean, controlled conditions.
Freshness and hygiene are prioritised at every step.
No processing. No alteration. No intervention.
Every product handled by Madugai follows the same core principles:
careful sourcing, disciplined handling, and controlled delivery.
Milk is collected daily from selected local farms that follow defined hygiene and handling expectations.
Milk is collected and transported exclusively in
SS 304 food-grade stainless steel milk cans
This maintains cleanliness and prevents contamination during transit.
Milk is chilled immediately after collection.
There is no prolonged exposure, no waiting period, and no unnecessary movement.
Milk is handled under clean, controlled conditions and prepared for delivery without extended storage.
Milk is delivered fresh to customer doorsteps every morning in reusable glass bottles.
Plastic contact is avoided by design.
Empty glass bottles are collected during the next delivery and circulated through a controlled cleaning and reuse process.
This routine is followed every day.
Not selectively. Not seasonally. Not when convenient.
Madugai operates on a subscription model by design.
This allows us to control sourcing, handling, and delivery without compromise.
Quality cannot be maintained through spot buying or irregular demand.
This is not a sales strategy.
Madugai subscription is intended for households that value:
If you are looking for occasional or ad-hoc purchases,
Madugai may not be the right fit.
The subscription begins with a sample request.
Once the sample experience is complete, subscription onboarding is enabled based on availability.
When capacity is reached, onboarding pauses.
This ensures service consistency for existing customers.
Changes, pauses, or updates to subscriptions are handled through defined processes.
Clarity and predictability are maintained for both customers and operations.
At Madugai, transparency is not a claim.
We believe customers deserve to see how their food is handled,
All handling and operations follow applicable food safety requirements.
License details are made available for reference.
Milk handled each day is subjected to regular quality checks.
Test reports are published as part of our transparency practice.

Milk is handled under clean, controlled conditions.
Food-grade materials are used throughout the handling process.
Sanitation and cleaning routines are followed consistently
SS 304 food-grade stainless steel milk cans
and delivered in reusable glass bottles.
Glass bottles are cleaned, sanitised, and circulated
Madugai milk is handled for daily consumption with strict temperature control and hygiene
It is not processed for extended shelf life or mass circulation.
Is anything added to the milk?
There is no added water, no preservatives, and no enhancement.
Why does Madugai use glass bottles?
Glass avoids plastic contact, preserves integrity, and supports a controlled reuse system.
It aligns with our handling discipline and hygiene standards.
How is the milk transported before delivery?
Milk is collected and transported in
SS 304 food-grade stainless steel milk cans
Why is Madugai priced higher than regular milk?
Because Madugai does not operate as a mass-market product.
Controlled sourcing, disciplined handling, glass bottles, and limited supply have a cost.
Do you offer discounts or offers?
Pricing reflects the cost of consistent quality and disciplined operations.
Madugai is intended for households that value consistency, discipline, and quality over convenience or price.
Can I buy occasionally without a subscription?
Madugai operates on a subscription model to maintain quality and consistency.
Occasional or ad-hoc purchases are not supported.
What happens if capacity is full?
Customer onboarding pauses when capacity is reached.
This ensures service quality for existing customers.
How can I verify quality claims?
Daily milk test reports, licensing details, and handling information are published under the

Madugai operates on defined processes and controlled capacity.
Responses are handled during working hours.
